title: Kris Marshall reveals the emotional reason he QUIT Death In Paradise after four years
text:
Kris Marshall reveals the emotional reason he QUIT Death In Paradise after four years Actor opened up about family struggles Share By Jessica Gibb 09:14, 2 FEB 2017 Updated 09:34, 2 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Rylan announces Calum Best will NOT be appearing Watch this video again Watch Next Celebrity Big Brother: Kim gets into a blazing ro 1:00 Celebrity Big Brother: Kim explodes at 'coward' J 0:31 Jedward snort lines of SUGAR in bizarre antics du 0:46 Viewers feel mixed about Piers not being on GMB t 0:59 Piers Morgan attempts to sing a Bee Gee's hit - a 0:32 EastEnders gaffe as Denise's hair goes from wavy 0:52 Holly and Phil get the giggles over a promo they 0:41 Phillip Schofield shocked by woman who was scamme 1:23 Jamie O'Hara says that Bianca is 'Wifey' material 1:14 Calum Best is evicted from the Celebrity Big Brot 1:02 James C puts salt in Coleen Nolan's tea 1:03 Video will play in Kris Marshall reveals the real reason he has quit 'Death in Paradise' Share this video Watch Next Share Get celebs Filming in the Caribbean might seem like a dream job, but Kris Marshall revealed it left him so “bereft” he had to quit the show.
Yesterday, it was revealed that the Death in Paradise actor quit the BBC series after four years playing Detective Inspector Humphrey Goodman.
And now the Love Actually star has opened up about the family heartache that caused his shock departure.
Read More Kris Marshall QUITS Death in Paradise after four years as Father Ted star Ardal O'Hanlon replaces him Kris Marshall revealed why he quit Death in Paradise (Photo: ITV) The 43-year-old revealed that in previous years he took his wife Hannah and four-year-old son Thomas with him as he jetted off to the Carribean to film.
But last year, after the arrival of his daughter Elsie and with Thomas starting school – he had to leave them behind.
“This last series I did do on my own, which was quite tough,” he told Susanna Reid and Ben Shepherd on Good Morning Britain.
Kris admitted being away from his family was tough (Photo: ITV) The 'juggling mission' became too much (Photo: ITV) “Skyping just leaves me bereft and then I have to go and drown my sorrows in the bar.”
He explained: “In previous years I’ve been able to take my family with me but we had a daughter this time last year and so bringing her and my son, he’s about to start school and it all became a bit of a juggling mission.
“So that was really the reason behind it.”
Kris Marshall wants to spend more time with his family (Photo: ITV) Being away from his family took its toll on the Modern Family star – and he now intends to spend more time with them.
But he admits the British weather has made him question his decision.
“I’m still wondering whether I’ve made the right decision,” he said.
Death in Paradise returns for its seventh series (Photo: BBC) “It is amazing and I’ve been filming in London since and there is a moment when you stand in the freezing cold in a large puffa jacket and go: ‘Why am I not in flip flops? Why am I still not in the Caribbean? What have I done?!”
Kris joined the programme at the beginning of the third series, following the exit of Ben Miller.
Now Father Ted star Ardal O'Hanlon will take the lead in the show's seventh series, with his first appearance coming on Thursday night before filming for the next season begins over spring.
